I used to like this game a lot. 

When I started off the game, I had tons of fun learning new tactics, killers, maps, perks, etc. I noticed a few issues here and there, but I figured that they were minor issues and I was either really new to the game or that the devs would patch out the issues.

As I'm slowly nearing 1k hours, I find that the laziness and the arrogance of the developers is killing the game. The meta right now has been the same for the past year or so, with it being extremely toxic on both the killer side and the survivor side. Killers need to do extremely unfun (for both sides) playstyles to stand even a mere chance at higher rankings, which includes things like singling out the weakest player on the survivor team (extremely unfun for that 1 individual), camping someone on the hook (extremely unfun for killer and that one individual), slugging survivors on the floor to build pressure (extremely stressful/unfun for killer and survivors alike), and so on. If survivors aren't in a premade party, then they have to pray to RNG-sus that their teammates are on the same wavelength as them. If not, then the lack of coordination can destroy a team within the first minute of the game. Even if all 4 survivors are amazingly skilled, the game is most efficiently played when objectives are rushed as quickly as possible. As such, if a survivor wishes to play as optimally as possible to escape, the best way is to be selfish/not help teammates, only focus on generators (which consists of holding down 1 button for 80 seconds for 5 generators), and hide whenever they think theyre in danger. Needless to say, that's extremely stale to play/face with/against.

Granted, I'm not a game developer and i can't say I know what works best for a video game as this. However, the DbD community is extremely helpful and has provided tons of tips/suggestions that the majority of the playerbase agrees would make the game much more healthy. Hell, theres even a dude on youtube who's made videos that are 10+ hours long explaining each individual perk, the issues with each perk, how to use the perk effectively, and what might make the perk better/worse. There's been so many suggestions that are 100% reasonable that have been effectively ignored, to which I can only imagine is due to the fact that the devs believe that they are 100% right in everything they do. Players have begged the devs to stop pumping out content on a 3 month cycle to take time and address the health issues of the game, yet the devs have specifically stated that they will not do such a thing in a live Q&A (which was an hour long stream, to which the developers typically would respond to all the questions with a "No" or "we'll see").

Finally, the biggest slap in the face: "sudden blood point events". The reason DbD can get away with how lazy it's being managed is due to the fact that there are nearly 0 competitors for this game. However, every time a potential competitor is announced  (or a big game), "coincidentally", the devs decide to surprise the community with a 5 day long event where players can play the game for 1.5x the average bloodpoints on the same weekend that the game is hosting a beta/launched. They've done this for Elden ring, VHS, etc). It feels the equivalent of the game begging its playerbase to stay when even the most mildest issue appears, then refusing to acknowledge the playerbase the second the issue is over.

Theres a crapload of issues that I haven't even touched on, like the poor handling of the infamous "blackface bubba", lack of any form of punishment for repeat offenders of the "reportable terms", the non existent anti-cheat, etc. 

I know there are a few people working for DbD who have put their heart and soul into this game. I know there are employees in this game who are extremely frustrated by their bosses, and wish to do much more for the game they love. For the small handful of employees in this boat, they have my honest sympathy. However, this game's playerbase is slowly leaving the game as the higher-ups of this game are lazy, only have a monetary drive, and have 0 passion for their craft.

If you're a newer player who saw footage of some streamer playing this game and thought it would be worth buying, don't. Seriously. I promise you, 10 games in, you'll slowly start to see a plethora of issues that could be easily fixed, but aren't.

What a damn shame.

This game saved my life.

I am 25.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline broken. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you
Fun, simple multiplayer "fix, run, hide" game.

Il gioco in sé è carino, nulla di eccezionale se si gioca sempre da soli, la musica cambia se facendo parte dei sopravvissuti si gioca con amici. Il killer è un ruolo divertente, certe volte si vince altre si perde, ogni killer ha le sue abilità e le sue debolezze (lentezza, grande preavviso di avvicinamento...), la cosa che mi da più fastidio è che se qualcuno vuole provare dei killer nuovi, deve o giocare tanto, per accumulare abbastanza valuta in gioco, oppure pagare piccole cifre, ma sempre pagare qualcosa per giocare. Overall non è male, gioco divertente e passatempo, avvertimento, troverete un botto di persone che a fine partita vi vomiteranno contro l'odio di una vita intera, ma lasciatele stare e se volete bloccatele.
its a really fun game to play with your friends. it doesn't take skill or anything but you have to be smart in out playing killers.

Buckle up you little shits because this one's gonna take a while.  This game is complicated for me to describe.  The foundation and I guess gameplay in green-ish rank is fun as hell, but there are major problems any new player needs to know about and I'm here with the limited time Behavior will let me before they realize what I'm doing.  
Toxic Players:  This community is probably the worse gaming community I have seen in a while.  And coming from a preson that has played Cod, Overwatch, and Fortnite for enough time to see what the community is like, says a lot.  A new player could stumble into a toxic survivor or killer and they can say some hurtful things to someone who doesn't even know how to play the game and get their experience ruined.
Bloodweb:  I personally do not see the level up system in this game called the "Bloodweb" as grindy because all you really have to do is get your character to level 50 and not even need to prestige your chosen character as it is only for cosmetic.  However the Bloodweb will take you a fair bit to get to level 50 for just one character so don't get your hopes up on leveling up fast.
How to deal with sucking at the game:  So at one point everyone is bad at something.  I do have tips that can also mentally help and prepare you for a match.  As a killer before you go into a match, try to lower your what the end match result will be.  Don't always think you will be good, expect to get at least one kill and if you get more at the end of the match than it will feel better trust me, I do it all the time because I have very poor self expectations for myself.  Also gl with survivor tips I have more playtime on killer trying to get more time tho, uhh just always expect to die I guess or something I guess.
Don't be a Dick!!!!:  Hey did that person either be a bad teammate or literally played the game correctly by killing you?  Well just always remember to be nice, because it is just a video game.  A piece of code.  be nice. please.
Conclusion:  So uh this games score is uhhhhhh 10/10 fuck off it owns my soul and I'm trying to get it back.
lost my sanity along the way
